question.title: Why does Eureka fail to detect new client instances when Spring Boot port is dynamically set to 0?
question.body:
I have verified that all configurations in both my Spring applications and the Eureka server are correctly set up. However, I am encountering an issue where two instances of my services, which are successfully registering with Eureka, are not appearing on the Eureka dashboard. Below are 2 instances when server.port=0

In the Eureka dashboard:

After providing a static port with

In the Eureka dashboard:

Is there any reason why this is happening? secondly, I can't request these clients i.e.:

String serviceBUrl = "http://INVENTORY-SERVICE/inventory";
List<InventoryResponse> inventoryResponseStocks = webClient
        .get()
        .uri(serviceBUrl, uriBuilder -> uriBuilder.queryParam("skuCode", skuCodes).build())
        .retrieve()
        .bodyToFlux(InventoryResponse.class)
        .collectList()
        .block();

Error:

io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsErrorCauseException: Query failed with NXDOMAIN
at io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext.onResponse(..)(Unknown Source) ~[netty-resolver-dns-4.1.111.Final.jar:4.1.111.Final]
